posts.title: The Detective In Hollywood
posts.excerpt: The Detective In Hollywood: The Movie Careers Of The Great Fictional Private Eyes And Their Creators is a fascinating study of classic Hollywood detective movies (and some of the nearly forgotten series like the Crime Doctor and Mr. Wong), based on interviews with some of the men and women involved in creating them (authors, directors, …

posts._title: Anne Émond – Les êtres chers AKA Our Loved Ones (2015)
posts.title: Les êtres chers
posts.excerpt: Guy’s tragic death is a shock for the Leblanc family. For many years, the real cause of his death is kept hidden from some members of the family, including his son David. The latter in turn starts his own family with his wife Marie. He lovingly raises his children Laurence and Frédéric, but deep within …

posts.title: Kiskanmak
posts.excerpt: Quote: It’s the 1930s. The Republic Day Ball is in progress in Zonguldak, a coal mining town in Turkey. Among the invited guests are the newcomers to this small and boring town: Halit, an engineer; his gorgeous wife Mukerrem, and Halit’s sister and unwanted household member Seniha. During the ball Seniha realizes she would be …

posts._title: Louis Feuillade – Le Gamin de Paris AKA Paris Urchin (1923)
posts.title: Le Gamin de Paris
posts.excerpt: Two war orphans, Joseph, apprentice printer, and Lisette, typist, live with their grandmother in Belleville. Lisette loves his next door neighbor, the painter Amedee, but this one does not offer him a union. Joseph Amedee learning is the son of a general, advocates for Lisette and everything ends in marriage.

posts._title: Daniel Duval – La dérobade AKA Memoirs of a French Whore (1979)
posts.title: La dérobade
posts.excerpt: Quote: Marie (Miou-Miou) is a young girl from a working-class family who falls for Gerard (Daniel Duval) before she discovers he is a vicious, sadistic pimp. She is degraded, abused, and beaten regularly by Gerard as she is forced into a life of prostitution. Marie later decides she must leave her pimp to regain control …

posts._title: Piero Messina – L’attesa AKA The Wait (2015)
posts.title: L’attesa
posts.excerpt: Quote: In the vast rooms of an ancient villa marked by the passing of time, Anna, following an unexpected bereavement, spends her days in solitude. The rugged and beautiful Sicilian countryside surrounds the house, isolating it whilst the fog, which slowly rises up the slopes of Etna, obstructs the view into the distance. Only the …

posts._title: Jean-Paul Civeyrac – La Vie Selon Luc AKA Life According To Luc (1991)
posts.title: La Vie Selon Luc
posts.excerpt: Review “dvdtimes.co.uk” wrote: Few of the characteristics that can be associated with Jean Paul Civyrac can be seen in his first film, a 14 minute short feature. Inevitably, considering its short length, the film is necessarily very much a character study, since there is little room to develop much in the way of a plot. …

posts.title: Borderline
posts.excerpt: An erotic drama about a woman facing her 30th birthday who looks back at her life growing-up with her grandmother, crazy mother and her over-indulgence with men, sex and alcohol.

posts._title: Shion Sono – The Virgin Psychics AKA Eiga: minna! Esupâ da yo! (2015)
posts.title: The Virgin Psychics
posts.excerpt: From Busan International Film Festival: High school student Kamogawa Yoshiro wakes up one day to discover that he has psychic superpowers. He also soon discovers that others in the city have the gift, only some of them are hellbent on causing trouble. posts._title: Andrey Nekrasov – Bunt. Delo Litvinenko aka Poisoned by Polonium (2007)
posts.title: Bunt Delo Litvinenko
posts.excerpt: “If anything should happen to me, I beg you to show this tape to the whole world.” On November 23rd, 2006, these words, spoken on camera by exiled former KGB and FSB (post communist Russia’s dreaded new secret police) agent Alexander “Sasha” Litvinenko, became a gruesome self-fulfilling prophecy. After an agonizingly painful ordeal, Litvinenko succumbed …
